Articles.Content:
So you can probably tell by how many different maneuvers and stuff I did, that this photo sequence took place over SEVERAL missions. I had to fly to the Mun like four times, reach escape velocity twice, land twice, splash down once, get on a return trajectory once, do three Transposition and Docking sequences, and fake a Lunar Docking once.

The end result, though, is a pretty believable looking Lunar Orbit Rendezvous Mission with the Kerpollo pack.

Here\'s the album. Every photo has a description.

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10151002863543830.451570.571363829&type=1&l=3ccfcf9d56
holy smokes thats awesome! what texture pack/mod you usin?? 8)

holy smokes thats awesome! what texture pack/mod you usin?? 8)

The crafts were part of GoDamnit\'s old 'Kerpollo' pack. After this album was made, I went ahead and actually redid the Command and Service Module so it would look a little more realistic. Here\'s a picture of it attached to the LM:
Damn I could teach someone all about the moon landings with these!

The end result, though, is a pretty believable looking Lunar Orbit Rendezvous Mission with the Kerpollo pack.

Impressive!
Damn O.O How did you do the docking both before and after the landing at the mun?

Damn O.O How did you do the docking both before and after the landing at the mun?

haha. I didn\'t. I launched several missions in different configurations to make it look like that. For the docking in lunar orbit, I cut the LM loose and then uploaded the photos backward to look like I was approaching and then connecting.

I think it took four Mun flights to get the Lunar Orbit sequences right.

haha. I didn\'t. I launched several missions in different configurations to make it look like that. For the docking in lunar orbit, I cut the LM loose and then uploaded the photos backward to look like I was approaching and then connecting.

I think it took four Mun flights to get the Lunar Orbit sequences right.

Wow, well f you because you got me excited lol. It looks amazing though, good job!
Wow, brilliant work. Must have taken a good long time to do.
